intro: Hieracium riglosianum, commonly known as the Sicilian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium riglosianum is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments.
